extendedInfo.description: Say hello to the Denon Remote App for Android phone! This new App will give you an unprecedented level of command and control over your Denon network ready A/V receiver or Music systems, 2012 or later models.Control the basic functions of your Denon product with power, volume, input and surround mode selection.8 customizable home screen short cut buttons allow you to tailor the look and function of the Denon Remote App to suit your needs.A multi-zone control page lets you adjust power, volume and input selection for all zones from a single screen.Super-fast Internet Radio browsing as well as easy favorite preset and recall capability will make surfing through the 30,000 free stations a breeze. Fast thumbnail browsing, library search and playlist creation make navigating your large digital media library easier than ever before.With the Denon Remote App, your Android phone just became an integral part of your home entertainment experience.'Main feature in Version 1.0â¢ Single Page Multi Zone Control Screen for AV Receiversâ¢ Assignable Home Screen Shortcut Buttonsâ¢ Fast Thumbnail Browsing for Network Music File Playback (*1)â¢ Playlist management for Network Music File Playback (Create/Edit/Delete)â¢ Frequency Direct FM Tuning â¢ Fast Internet Radio Browsing (*1)â¢ Volume Limit Settingâ¢ Denon Blu-ray Player Control when paired with New â13 Series AVR and Blu-ray 2012 Models (*2)â¢ Photo Slideshow Transition Adjustment â¢ AVR and Multi Zone Renaming Capabilityâ¢ Simple Home Screen Help Displayâ¢ Multi-Language Support (English, French, German, Spanish, Dutch, Italian, Swedish, Japanese, Simplified Chinese, Russian and Polish) (*3)Notes*1. During fast network browsing, the AVR GUI and Remote App display may be temporarily out of sync.*2. An HDMI connection between the AVR and Blu-ray player (HDMI control setting = On for both AVR/Blu-ray Player) is required.*3. The OS language setting is automatically detected; when not available, English is selected.- Compatible Network models: 2013 New Models:[North America]Network AV Receiver: AVR-X4000, AVR-X3000, AVR-X2000, AVR-X1000, AVR-E400, AVR-E300[Other Countries] *Product availability varies depending on regions.Network AV Receiver: AVR-X4000, AVR-X3000, AVR-X2000, AVR-X10002012 Models[North America]Network AV Receiver: AVR-4520CI, AVR-3313CI, AVR-2313CI, AVR-2113CI, AVR-1913, AVR-1713, AVR-1613Network Music System: CEOL piccolo (DRA-N5)[Other Countries] *Product availability varies depending on regions.Network AV Receiver: AVR-4520, AVR-3313, AVR-2313, AVR-2113, AVR-1713Network Music System: CEOL (RCD-N8), CEOL piccolo (DRA-N5)Network Audio Player: DNP-F109* Not compatible with Denon models other than those listed above.Note:Please update your AVR to the latest firmware by following each User manual.Please set the "IP Control / Network / Network Controlâ = âAlways On / On" of the device to ensure a smooth operation with the Denon remote app.Compatible Android devices:â¢ Android Smartphones which Android OS ver.2.3(or higher) or ver.4.0(or higher) is installed.ã* This application does not support Android OS ver.3.x.ã* This application does not support tablet devices.â¢ Screen resolution: 800x480, 854x480, 1280x720ã* This application does not support smartphones in QVGA(320x240) and HVGA(480x320) resolution.â¢ Confirmed Android devices:Samsung(Google) Nexus (OS4.1.1), Samsung(Google) Nexus S (OS4.1.2), Samsung Galaxy S (OS2.3.6), LG Optimus LTE (OS2.3.5), HTC Nexus One (OS2.3.6)Caution:We do not guarantee that this application works with all Android devices.

reviews.title: Very Nice App
reviews.comment: Works fine on Galaxy 3 with the new X and E series of AV receivers. It communicate with the AVR through WiFi then uses the control through HDMI to control other devices connected to the AVR. What I like most is the ability to play music and control the AVR without turning the TV on. My only wish is they enhance the Pandora player to include Pandora\'s full functionality such as see the play history and thumb the songs up or down.
reviews.author: Eyal Kattan

reviews.comment: Demon your new update doesn\'t work on nexus 7 or my Sony xperia u! Just puts volume on full all time which will deck my speakers, sort it out!
reviews.author: Stephen Ryland

reviews.title: Touchy app!
reviews.comment: I don\'t have another system to compare to. But app is touchy. Somtimes it shows all three zones turned on. Pandora is hit or miss. I do an update on app and rcvr firmware hoping for more stable app.
reviews.author: Dennis Zacek

reviews.title: Good app needs to support older receivers
reviews.comment: This app is a reasonable app.  It works better for me then the other apps I\'ve tried.  But it only works for the newest rev of the receivers.  I have a 3312 that I bought 2 years ago. The on screen interface looks identical, slow in all the same spots.  Denon could release a firmware patch for the receiver if needed. But they shouldn\'t discount the current owners, we are the ones who will either praise or dam them and that\'s how reputations get made for good or bad...
reviews.author: Chris Maloney

reviews.title: Works perfectly with my AVR-2313
reviews.comment: I love it. I haven\'t had any issues with it at all.
reviews.author: Jeffrey Richard

reviews.title: Very poor...
reviews.comment: Using this to control a CEOL Piccolo; recent updates have made this more stable but it\'s still pretty poor.  Spotify integration is inadequate (give us the full Spotify app options!) and the media player option isn\'t great either...it doesn\'t seem to utilise mp3 tags to search or sort albums and playback is only available alphabetically!  Who listens to an album alphabetically? By way of a workaround, I\'m actually using the Bubble upnp app to control my NAS. Two stars now...up from my initial one! Shame.
reviews.author: Paul Anthony

reviews.title: Is this a joke?
reviews.comment: The alarm doesn\'t work. If it did, it\'s still missing essentials like weekday/weekend distinction. The power button is terribly close to the play view button. I cannot play music from my phone. It doesn\'t remember the last device used. Navigation is cumbersome and unintuitive. Seriously disappointing. I just bought an expensive, dumb dlna renderer it seems.
reviews.author: Grischa Meyer

reviews.title: Just OK re:1.04
reviews.comment: This app needs a usability upgrade. I upgraded from a 3808 to an X4000 and one feature I was really looking forward to was better app speed and integration. I guess I got both but hardly the improvement I was looking for.  Two simple fixes I would like to see: 1) open the app to the last used screen. Example: I use zone 1 and 2 often and would like the app to open to the zones screen. 2) Every time I select HD Radio it automatically goes to the tuner screen. I only use 1 station and just have to wait for th
reviews.author: Robert Ballantyne

reviews.title: Still rubbish
reviews.comment: Fix media server in the app! If I unlock phone and attempt to skip to next track, my 3313 drops the connection and I have to restart the app. Same if I want to go back to folders to pick new music. Of you get this right, the app will be perfect.
reviews.author: Anthony Lardo

reviews.comment: Still no support for xx12 receivers which were originally promised this.\tAnd then to rub salt in this wound it manages to detect and partially operate a Pioneer VSX527 that I also have whilst being completely unable to even see my 3312!   Come on Denon this cannot be that costly for you to implement surely.  By not supporting my receiver will not pressure me to upgrade it so that\'s no excuse either.
reviews.author: Ian Fretwell

reviews.title: Love It...
reviews.comment: Using CEOL N8 and Galaxy S4 combo. Works great, however there is still room for improvment. Like changing source without stopping the previous would be great. Overall good.
reviews.author: Peter Baker

reviews.comment: Still crap....why the hell can\'t it support the same receivers as the iphone astounds me. Next time I buy an amp it wont be a denon. Pity cant give zero stars\tAs others have stated why the android version doesn\'t support xx12 amps like the iPhone version does is ludicrous.
reviews.author: mark shark

reviews.title: No All-Zone Stereo Option?
reviews.comment: While the app is a little clunky, it does a great job allowing me to control the receiver from my phone, which is great when I\'m using a Chromecast and Airplay via the Remote for iTunes app. Unfortunately I can\'t find an option on the app to enable all-zone stereo mode - which is the ONLY way to get music from my Chromecast to play in Zone 2. Without being able to do that from my phone, I can\'t use my phone to start playing music from the Google Play Music app without leaving my kitchen (zone 2) and going to the receiver to enable all-zone stereo mode. Add that feature, and you\'ll have an extra star from me!
reviews.author: Joshua Sklarsky

reviews.title: No landscape support
reviews.comment: Clearly this is an iOS app based up the layout. There is no landscape support, which is awful.
reviews.author: Eric Sturm

reviews.title: Was fine, now not
reviews.comment: This app initially worked fine with my Android Siii and iphone4 but after updating the Denon firmware the app now can\'t find my CEOL. Useless. Echoing previous comments,  this app needs a full overhaul and professional help.
reviews.author: Gordon Gilkison

reviews.title: Works but terrible slow
reviews.comment: Hopeing for a smoother and better app. Spotify is nearly unless as it is now.
reviews.author: Martin Pettersson

reviews.title: Slow
reviews.comment: Slow in loading, playing and drops off intermittently. Please improve app.
reviews.author: LS Kim

reviews.title: Eh
reviews.comment: Nice features, but it constantly crashes and is not very fast
reviews.author: Carl Holzhauer

reviews.title: Works well
reviews.comment: Wish it were a total controller replacement, but what it does it does well.
reviews.author: Nick Groh

reviews.title: Not working with RCD-N7
reviews.comment: The iphone version does
reviews.author: Oliver Wagner
